DecisionRevisit: ^I'm afraid I've run out of dialogue.
BeginQuest: ^Good morning, how may I help you?
^Is it true that you live here on Campus?

g-0: ^Yes, and I work here too. Oh, in this building over here. My room's window overlooks this courtyard. That's why I care about having greenery here.

MainArgumentNode: ^Why would you prefer to keep the greenery?
^What will other people using this space gain from it?
^What do you think about creating a parking lot here?
^What do you think about a food corner?
^Do you like the idea of setting up a gallery here?
Question_01: ^Please, just look at these buildings… They're gray, and the greenery makes it at least a bit cozier here. Additionally, in the summer, the greenery helps muffle the noise.
Question_02: ^I like that everyone can come here and sit in a secluded place. It could use more benches, more trees, and some shrubbery.
Question_03: ^Oh, please don't do that! It will be hot and noisy! And the exhaust fumes from the parked cars will come straight through the window into my room.
Question_04: ^I understand that everyone would like to grab a quick bite on their break. But, please, think about all the odours! I'll never be able to air out my room again.
Question_05: ^If we keep the greenery, we can set up an open-air gallery among the trees. However, for now I don't have an idea on how to make such a place more lively.
